title: Direction Ratios and Cosines Quiz
description: Test your understanding of direction ratios and cosines.

questions.question: What is the relationship between direction cosines?
options: cos α + cos β + cos γ = 1
cos α · cos β · cos γ = 1
cos α = cos β = cos γ
questions.explanation: The sum of the squares of the direction cosines is always equal to 1.

questions.question: For vector a=(3,4,5), what are the direction cosines?
questions.explanation: Direction cosines are components divided by magnitude: 3/√(9+16+25) = 3/√50, etc.

questions.question: Direction ratios are:
options: The actual components of the vector
questions.explanation: Direction ratios are simply the components a1, a2, a3 of the vector.

questions.question: The direction cosines of a unit vector are:
questions.explanation: For a unit vector, the direction cosines are exactly equal to its components.

questions.question: How can you find the angle between two vectors using direction cosines?
options: Use the formula: cos θ = Σ(cos α₁ cos α₂)
questions.explanation: cos θ = cos α₁ cos α₂ + cos β₁ cos β₂ + cos γ₁ cos γ₂
